verb.description: To retrace (a flight path or course); to fly over (an area) again. Also (of astronauts, aircrew, etc.): to carry out (a mission) again.
To convey or send in flight again; to send (a rocket, piece of equipment, etc.) on a second or subsequent flight.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in John Florio (1553–1625), author and teacher of languages. From re- + fly.
